The breakfast staff polite but when I'm given a hand-written receipt of my meal with Total:, Tax:, Tip: all hand written on a register paper I get a little suspicious. Is my money really being put in the register? I would have had a terrible stay if the front desk had not moved me on my arrival. My first room was facing an onramp of I-5 and after the second motorcycle roared on the ramp and onto I-5 I looked outside and the highway was 30 feet from the building. No sound proofing of any kind except for the thick vinyl curtain over the window. I thought I was over the highway the noise was so loud from trucks, etc. going to LA. Once I got moved to the front of the hotel overlooking the registration area it was a very pleasant place. I just felt so sorry for later arrivals facing the back rooms. If I went back to Old Town I'd stay in the Holiday Inn Express up the street. I don't know about the rooms there but I don't think any of their rooms are on the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you love freeway noise!”
Reviews.Author: cvp3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new looking and attractive, but the rooms are small and noisy, if you're unfortunate enough to have one of the rooms that are directly facing the freeway. Yes, I could have asked for another room, but once you get settled in at night with 2 small kids, trust me, its not worth it. I didn't want to pay the $15 parking fee, so I parked on the street. $15 doesn't seem warranted in that part of Old Town. I found street parking at 6 p.m. Friday night. Pros: The rooms are clean and look new. The staff is friendly and helpful. Cons: Our room was facing the freeway. It was basically backed right up ON TOP OF THE FREEWAY. I ran the fan all night hoping it would mask some of the noise, but was woken up several times by noisy vehicles. Very small rooms. O.K. for adults, but not good for families with kids! Even though the nearby Best Western Hacienda is older, dated, and has a confusing layout I would choose it because of the bigger rooms and better location within Old Town. If you do decide to stay here make SURE you request a room away from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent San Diego Option”
Reviews.Author: GraftonTraveler24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights after abandoning Humphrey's Half Moon Inn. We did not have a reservation but the staff was friendly and helpful as they rearranged other shorter stays to accomodate us. The room was excellent. It was clean and neat with a king bed. Our room overlooked the pool. Try to get a room away from the highway. The hotel restaurant had an excellent breakfast buffet. The location was great for exploring Old Town and central for the whole city with easy highway connections and it's not too far from the trolley. Overall, we were pleasantly surprised after leaving our original hotel. We would stay hear again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “OK but get a room away from freeway side”
Reviews.Author: UKUK-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for two nights at the Courtyard... Initially booked into a room overlooking the Freeway - the noise was as if the windows were open. Complained in the middle of the night because I just couldn't sleep. Promised that our room would be changed for a quieter one the following day. This was duly done and the noise reduction was remarkable - just moving from one side of the hallway to the other. Hotel on the whole was OK for a large chain - expensive for the facilities on offer so just OK

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Treeless
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard! We had a problem at the beginning with workmen already staying in our room. The front desk girl forgot to properly check them in so we got a surprise when we opened the door. The asst. mgr. was very apologetic as was the front desk girl. He quickly put us in another room and did not charge us the $15 per day parking fee. We stayed 3 days so we saved $45. The room and bed were very clean and comfortable. The first day we asked to have the room cleaned by 3 pm so we could take a nap and it was cleaned. The second day we forgot to ask and the maid came in just as we got back in the room. She apologized for being late but said she had lots of rooms to clean. She hurriedly cleaned up and gave us a happy new year card and thanked us for our patience. We ate the breakfast buffet all 3 mornings and it was very good! Eggs cooked to order or omelet or scrambled, potatoes, sausage, bacon, fruit, waffles, toast, bagels, oatmeal, yogurt. Parking underneath the hotel was designed for small cars and was cramped. It was difficult parking and getting out. Overall we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: namroon
Reviews.Content: An excellent experience with a good location and excellent staff. The location in Old Town is not only a good site for exploring Old Town, but it is minutes by car from the Airport and Downtown San Diego. It is next to Interstate 5 and it is advisable to request a room facing away from the highway. Since we did this, we could not hear any highway noise. For those without a car, there is a nearby trolley going to the center of San Diego at minimal cost. The staff is excellent. The general manager, Mr. Stringfield, is cheerful and always ready to give helpful advice on sightseeing and restaurants (he enjoys fine dining). We requested a refrigerator and down pillows, and they were in the room when we arrived. The staff at the front desk was helpful and gracious. There is an hourly shuttle to the Airport at no charge. Although parking costs $15/day, parking on the street is always available. Although we ate out most of the time (our son lives in San Diego) the food in the cafe seemed attractive. Suggestion: In addition to the cookies and occasional ice cream provided gratis, there should be fresh fruit for the health conscious guest.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: quakerquisp
Reviews.Content: looks exactly as pictured we had room w/2 queen beds(yes queen) very clean,beds comfy, shower fine, not much room on bathroom counter you could move the coffee pot. Right when you walk in to the right is the bathroom door if open you can hit it behind that is a mirrored closet. Secure parking is 15.00 need a key card for gate. Everyone very nice and friendly. Old Town is a 5 minute walk. Coyote Cantina very good food. Did not eat at hotel(Rickys at hotel circle very good breakfast and lunch) Would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard San Diego Old Town
HotelInfo.Address: 2435 Jefferson Street, San Diego, CA 92110
